paper_abstract: We show that for every 0 < epsilon < 1/2, there is an n(0) = n(0)(epsilon) such that if n > n(0) then every n-vertex graph G of size at least epsilon((n)(2)) and at most (1 - epsilon) ((n)(2)) contains induced k-vertex subgraphs with at least 10(-7) k different sizes, for every k <= epsilon n/3. This is best possible, up to a constant 3 factor. This is also a step toward a conjecture by Erdos, Faudree, and Sos on the number of distinct pairs (vertical bar V(H)vertical bar, vertical bar E(H)vertical bar) of induced subgraphs of Ramsey graphs. (c) 2008 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 34, 45-53. 2009
